column1: sharp pace, but swinging down the leg side. England are off the mark as Roy attempts a flick but can't time it
141kph, shaping into the right-hander, but on a leg-stump line once more, and Roy tucks a clip to short midwicket
shorter, wider, chopped fiercely past point! That's how Roy likes to roll, emphatic forearms, powered through the ball, and the fielder has no chance!
squared up a touch on a leg-stump line once more, angling in from middle-and-leg, and Roy topples forward in an emphatic block
jeepers, that's a tight leave! Bending inexorably towards the top of off, Roy holds his bat inside the line and it was length more than anything that was the deciding factor
solid and emphatic once more! It's been a fine over, but it's cost nine already, as Roy leans on a fuller length, full face through the line, and whistling through the covers.
so close! Was Roy tempted by the gap at second slip? An open-faced steer, or an attempt at least ... but he just avoids snicking through to the keeper
shuffling to the crease, with that dramatic javelin jab of the arm, and swinging into a front-foot block
half-forward once more, as Bairstow tucks his bat behind the line and defends to cover
nibble, nibble! Bairstow is lured forward by the wide approach on the crease, playing for the one angled in, but beaten by one that nips away!
solidly forward, head over the ball, and blocked urgently to cover
this is a fine over from Bumrah, tight and threatening with every ball on a full length, angled in. Blocked
fenced down to third man off a controlled outside edge. They jog the single to spoil the maiden over. But it's been a lively start at both ends of the pitch
struck dead in front of the stumps, but a big inside edge! Crikey, that would have been stone-dead, but Shami knew
slashed, inside edge, four runs! Bairstow living dangerously, flinging his bottom hand through the line and so nearly taking his off stump with it! But there's no-one to cut it off at fine leg
fenced firmly into the covers
wider line, left alone with a flourish outside off
flogged firmly into the covers! Half-stopped as mid-off ran round to intercept
this one scuttles! Intriguing signs, as the ball keeps low outside off and Bairstow is flat-footed on a wafty drive
poked firmly into the gap in the covers, Roy takes his chance to play Bumrah from the other end ...
right behind the line of the ball, pushed with solid hands out to point
firm in defence once again
wider on the crease and fires in the yorker! But Bairstow is equal to it, punching it with bottom hand up to mid-off
slightly mis-directed this time, on the pads, and Bairstow needs no second invitation, clipping with the angle towards the short boundary. Pant made good ground but the ball dribbled out of his reach
fenced to the leg side, solid in defence once more
sizzler outside off, and Dhoni is beaten as well as the batsman! Wicked late wobble from an impeccable seam position, and England pinch the bye
clipped off the toes once more, as England keep the runs ticking in the face of a threatening new-ball burst
another slashed inside-edge! Bairstow has got that shot down to a tee! Once again, a cramped drive, with the bottom elbow losing shape on impact, and the stumps nearly wearing the deflection!
more robust in defence this time, leaning forward to block into the covers
clipped off the toes to short midwicket
hard-handed once again from Bairstow! He's by a distance the least settled of England's openers, but he's finding a way nonetheless. A thick outside-edge this time as third man sweeps around
striding onto the front foot, firmly clumped up to long-off for the single
leg-stump line, YJB stretches forward and nudges to the leg side
flogged by Bairstow! Drifting onto the legs, he opens his stance a fraction and batters a lofted drive over long-on! One bounce, just inside the rope
beaten by a big turner outside off! Off come the bails, to lots of excitement but his back foot is well anchored
fenced out through point, a long chase as they sprint back for two
striding forward on a middle-stump line and blocked.
firm lines from Roy once more, meeting the angle into the bat with a perfectly posed drive to mid-off
extra nip on the back foot! Roy wears this on the glove, but Bairstow is alert, stealing the single to point as the fielder swoops in
sliding into the legs, a slightly wafty one-handed wallop across the line as Bairstow fails to line up a pull
width from Bumrah, Bairstow meets it at the top of the bounce with a cross-batted chop into the gap at point. Another useful single to the cause
edged, but soft hands! Hits the bat hard from wide on the crease, but slip gathers on the second bounce
flicked to the leg side, another over negotiated
slides back and across, creating room for a punch to the off side
fired in on a leg-stump line, Roy stretches those dodgy hamstrings to defend on the front foot
dancing feet, looking for the cut through point, not quite timed
nudged into the off side with dancing feet
crashed with power through the covers! Waiting on the back foot, ready to pounce, and with a nugget of width he was ready to unleash those forearms

contemptuous! Slower through the air from Chahal, a long way outside off too. But Roy read it from the hand, waited on one knee, and pounded it with glee through midwicket! This is a very promising sign for England...
firm block on the back foot, down to mid-on
high elbow, firm in defence once more
Bairstow throws his hands through the line once again, a touch too tight to the body for the drive
clipped off the toes to the leg side
back of a length, angled into the off stump, blocked with intent into the covers
maiden for Bumrah! That angle into the right-hander pays dividends once again, but England still going well against the other bowlers...
a violent smear! Outside off, and Roy takes the view that it ain't hitting the stumps so it can be dispatched anywhere. No contact this time, but the intent is plain ...
fuller length, shaping back into the right-hander, a good riposte, as Roy drives off an inside edge to midwicket
well bowled again from Shami, dragging the length back a touch, attacking the top of off, and drawing a respectful, head-bowed block
solid in defence once more. Ten dots in a row now as the pressure is cranked up a touch
angled defence into the off side, a single at last
solid defence on the off stump, to end the Powerplay with another tight over
outside off, swished with an open face down to third man
back of a length outside off, pushed back down to the bowler
flipped off the pads to the leg side
short and sharp, good change-up and Roy is beaten on the pull as Dhoni gathers in front of his face
big appeal from India, but the umpire signals a wide! Roy was using his feet, attempting a slashing pull, the ball past close to the gloves, and yes, a review would have dismissed him!
launched over long-off! Does Roy believe his luck is in? He certainly plays this one with the freedom of the reprieved! A majestic clobber high into the stands!
chancy but safe! Roy throws the hands once more, doesn't connect properly this time, but cover can't swing round to intercept ... gosh ... what a sliding doors moment!
pushed with an open stance into the covers
Roy rocks back, climbing into a cut, but point is well placed to cut it off
a bottom-handed flog, along the ground to long-off
on the back foot, meeting the legbreak with a tentative closed-batted dab
drift and spin, and Bairstow is beaten! Caught in two minds on the back foot ... misses the edge and the stumps by a whisker!

absolutely pounded, and so close to holing out to Bumrah! Any more elevation and it would have been straight down his throat at deep midwicket. Instead it skipped one bounce off the turf, thudding into his upturned palms
a round-house pull through the leg side, timing and placement as England keep the runs pumping
that is majestic! Planting the front foot, flinging the hands through the line, and dumping the ball with the straightest of swings for a one-bounce four over long-on!
banged into the pitch, down the leg side, a slight deflection prevents the wide
slower ball, ghosting into the pads as Bairstow tucks a shot to midwicket
angled into the pads, clipped with poise through square leg
angling forward, closing the face on impact, another good over, so no need to up the ante at the end of it
reverse sweep! Pinged through backward point to put the pressure on Chahal right from the start of the over ...
crashed out to short cover! Excitement for the crowd, but that was a bump ball
formidable and punishing! Bairstow seizes on the length, pirouetting through his bended knee and battering a slog sweep high over cow corner!
leans back for a fierce cut into the covers. Intercepted again, but every shot right now is a furious one ...
googly into the pads, Bairstow can't fence it away as it deflects to the leg side
head over the ball, solid block to dot up another run-laden over
a cautiously blocked sighter off the back foot, making space on the leg side, but exercising caution
that is a stunning straight blow! One sighter is ample as Roy saunters to the pitch of the ball and lambasts a flat drive over the bowler's head!
dancing at the crease again, cut hard into the covers
full toss, and crashed with stiff forearms over wide long-on! Pick your spot, and cash in!
a delicate dab, down on one knee, deflected so fine for a long chase through backward square. A good slide cuts off the boundary
eased with lots of bottom hand to mid-on
opens the face, and guides a checked drive into space in the covers. Gasps from the crowd, but fell well short ...
leaning back for an ungainly wipe, misses out

there's a man back on the rope, but Bairstow has got too much on this one! Spring-loaded forearms once again, picking the ball up from a full, leg-stump line, and KL Rahul flings himself backward at long-on to no avail!
eased into the leg side for a measured single
wide line, cracked with power into the covers, as Roy bends his knee into a stretched smear-drive

launched once again! England are now officially on the rampage! Another ball in the slot, another contemptuous club over long on! The ante has been upped, the game has been raised ... the World Cup survival fight is ON!
fuller one driven straight past the bowler
eased down to long-on from a full length on leg stump
crashed through the offside again, but didn't have the timing on it, so long-off is able to run to his left and clean up
clipped comfortably off his pads to long-on to raise a fine fifty on comeback. What a difference Jason Roy has made today
that is just thumped. THUMPED. Dances down the track, gets to the pitch and lifts this over the sight screen. Shredded
down the track again, but Kuldeep has managed to get this to dip a bit so Roy ends up defending it back with a straight bat
stayed in his crease to guide this fine, but not fine enough so short third man fields it
quicker one, skids through and stabbed out towards cover
some drift in that and Bairstow unable to whip this off his pads. Three dots in a row!
googly, and he's not read it at all, goes back to slash it but it goes flat and spins back in to hit him on the pads. Easily going down leg, despite the excitable (and understandable) appeal
fuller this time, driven firmly to cover

slam! five dot balls and Bairstow rocks back to smear this over wide long-on. No fielder there, and it just clears the rope. An over that was looking like it could hand back some control to India has ended up costing six runs - that's been England's batting today
wanted to club that into one of the canals in Birmingham, but didn't get hold of it, one bounce to deep midwicket
goes back and across to flick this off his hips almost to deep midwicket from the back foot

slows it up, and Roy is a mite early into the drive, ends up toe-ending it back to the bowler. Bump ball, so even though Kuldeep tot into a tangle with Bairstow while going for it, wouldn't have mattered if he caught it
goes back and tucks this to short fine
that one's outta here! Slog sweep from the Steve Waugh manual, going down on one knee and well forward, read the length and the turn and just sent it over the boundary
clipped to deep square that time for a couple
down the track, giving himself room and slashes this over cover. There is protection in the deep, but it's in the gap enough to net two
length outside off, Roy was a touch early into his punch. Some balls seem to hold up when pitched on a length. Goes safely though into the cover region
fuller, driven crisply, but straight to cover
ooh swing and a miss to one that kept low. Fuller length outside off, cross-seam, and Roy's big drive connects with air
gets hold of that one, back of a length outside off and slashed through point, but there is a man in the deep
slower ball fools Bairstow! But his checked off-drive falls safely. That spooned up in the air over mid-off, but well short of long-off
clears long-on again! The luck is firmly with Bairstow in this game. Down the track, didn't get hold of it exactly, but got enough meat to go over long-on
good length turning into him, he turns it off the back foot with soft hands to deep square
good length on off, spinning into him, stands tall and punch to long-on
he's still tossing it up, and Roy clears his front leg out to smear this with power straight down the ground. Not off the middle of the bat though, so long-off has time to come around

inside edged onto boot. Minor victory for the bowler. Went for a booming drive that rolled off inside edge and boot into the offside. For a moment, Bairstow thought that might have gone on the stumps, but the inside edge has been his friend today too
googly, plays it off the back foot, read it off the pitch and jabbed it towards gully
swing and a miss! Slower ball, on a length outside off and keeps low again
digs it in short - they've not really explored that option, India's quicks, today - but Roy is equal to it, pulls it powerfully to deep square
length ball, nipping into him a bit, uses the angle to turn it to deep square
slower bouncer outside off, waits for it and doesn't go too hard on the pull, keeps it down to deep square
slower ball off-cutter again, coming into his pads, stabbed past mid-on. Hung in the air for a bit, but safe
fuller on off stump, clipped to mid-off and they get a quick single. Direct hit from Chahal there but the batsman was in

Jadeja pulls off a blinder at long-on Roy is in disbelief, but he'll have to go I think. This was a bit of a top-spinner, Roy got to the pitch to cart it down the ground but didn't get the elevation. It still looked like a one bounce four until Jadeja came sprinting to his left, dived full length and plucked the ball inches from the ground. He's a wonder in the field is Jadeja, and it's needed that moment of outlandish brilliance to break this opening stand.
fuller, driven gently to long-on to get off the mark
nice length, gets Bairstow stretching forward to smother it in defence
nice drift from Kuldeep across Bairstow, but he comes forward again and smothers it in defence
googly, and he plays it off the back foot, guiding it to short third man for a quick single
goes deep in his crease to clip this off his pads to short fine leg
angling into Root, who stays in his crease and glides this down to third man
back of a length, stays in his crease and punches, there's a fumble by the cover fielder, and allows a single

run out chance but safe. A touch too full and clipped off his pads to deep square leg. The fielder is quick on his feet and rifles in a throw to the non-striker's end, forcing Bairstow to dive. The throw wasn't the best, so he's safe
steered to third man
yorker goes wrong, full toss on the pads, flicked to fine leg

half-deliberate outside edge goes for four. He was looking to open the face and play it fine, but not that fine too. Just about eludes a diving Dhoni's right glove, in fact I think it brushed it, on the way to the boundary
length ball outside off, holds its line after pitching, pushed to cover
brilliance from Bairstow. Toying with the field now. Saw the ball flighted and full and pulled out the reverse sweep. No short third man and too fine for the man on the boundary. Perfectly executed
comes on the front foot to nudge this towards square leg
spinning into him from outside off, he goes back and plays with the turn to flick this to midwicket. The fielder dives but can't stop cleanly
good length, forward defensive, rare shot
nicely tossed up, Bairstow stays in his crease and drills this to long-off
slower ball, back of a length outside off, a slightly tentative push takes the inside edge and bounces down, trickles past off stump
he's figured out that slowing up the pace works better has Hardik and he's bowling at that speed. This one is guided past backward point
fuller on the stumps, Root gets behind the line to defend
fuller and still very straight, normal pace, uses his wrists to turn this into the leg-side

bouncer to Biairstow on 99! Pacy one surprised him a bit, went over his left shoulder. Misses out on the hook. Kohli teases a review but he's not going for one. And replays confirm there was no edge anyway

first World Cup hundred for Bairstow. Back of a length and pulled to deep square for the single that will get him there. He had some stuff to say before this game, and even started off tentatively here, but he's backed up his words with deeds. Been irresistible for the second two thirds of his innings.
fuller, comes forward and pats it in defence
didn't read that, normal legspinner spinning into him, goes off the pad

that's just outrageous. Most people have different sweep shots. He has different reverse sweeps. He had hit one very fine earlier. Now that the fielder is fine, he smashes one square. Leaves the fielders standing
googly, he follows it with his hands to try and dab it to third man but misses
stroked to cover
another reverse sweep! This is just mastery and disdain. Picks out yet another gap, past backward point this time. Whew
Back of a length, nipping into him, goes back and tucks to fine leg
length ball on the stumps, flat-batted to mid-on
too short, sat up, slower ball, and he waits for it and smears it to deep midwicket
good length outside off, dabbed to third man
fuller outside off, had a thrash at it without moving his feet, rolls to backward point off the under-edge
slower bouncer outside off, such lack of pace it dies on Dhoni too and drops in front of him. He tried to cut it but was too early into the shot
bowls this on middle and leg line though, and his tucked to deep square leg
length ball on middle and leg again, Root goes inside the line and clips it fine enough to get two
a mite shorter, he goes deep in his crease to pull, but doesn't get hold of it, only travels to square leg
quicker and flatter, thuds into the pads, defeats his flick
gives it more air, and Root stretches his front foot forward to clip this to mid-on
keeping to that restrictive line - I guess the slip is there for the surprise googly - but he hasn't bowled any wrong uns this over. Middle and leg, cramping him up, and he whips to short fine leg
bangs it into the pitch outside off but at slower pace, Bairstow has to manufacture pace on it, pulls it from outside off to deep square
beauty. There's a half appeal, but that went off the pad to Dhoni perhaps. Yes, off the pad, seamed in and snuck through between bat and pad and went to Dhoni. No lbw because too high
flicked off his toes through midwicket
another slower bouncer outside off, but gets this to rise till the shoulder. Root adjusts to tap it down to third man
he's going to bowl short outside off, without pace, to Bairstow. Has three fielders on the legside boundary too. Bowls it again and Bairstow mis-times his hoick into the legside
back of a length coming into him, flicked off his pads to deep square
drifts on the legs to start though and is easily turned to square leg
oooh, almost fell in the trap. Bowled it on the leg stump and got Bairstow to go inside and sweep, but short fine is in place
another one full and down leg side, but misses his line a bit so it'll be a wide. Excitement from the crowd because the bails were dislodged, but off dhoni's pads
big shout, not given. Bairstow was clearing his front foot to slog sweep, dont' think he got an inside edge, but that might have been missing leg
pushed through quicker, glided to short third man
quicker again on the stumps, stabbed out to extra cover
patted back to the bowler
back of a length, finds the spot in the pitch from which there isn't much bounce. On off stump, Root defends from the crease
fuller, he's walking forward and across and clips this off his toes to mid-on's right. Wayward throw means there is no danger in the quick single
fuller on the fourth stump, cover-driven but not timed, and straight to cover. Took his top hand off the bat too while driving.

caught at deep point! Shami will feel he has earned this wicket even though it's come off a very tame shot. This one was dug into that length area outside off again, didn't rise a whole lot, he was looking to thrash it through the offside but ends up slashing to the man stationed perfectly. End of a great innings
dug in short, well directed and Morgan clambers down out of the way
teasing line, rising from a length outside off, Morgan allows this one through
over the wicket, sliding across the right-hander, who goes back as the ball skips through to Dhoni
flighted, straightening on middle and leg, worked away defensively
tossed up, Root leans on it and taps in front of extra cover for a quick single
gives this some air, Morgan goes for the reverse-sweep early, not the fullest connection and short third man cuts it off
doesn't pick the wrong'un, nearly cuts him in half going back! Tried to cut but the ball zipped back at him aggressively, just manages to keep it away from the timbers
tossed up and touched behind square on the leg side, just another single to finish a good over
round the wicket to Morgan, comes across on off and defends
full, 143kph/89mph outside off, gets him flirting with the drive and beats the outside edge
fullish, driven back down the ground without timing

short ball, Morgan sends a spiralling top edge on the hook - taken! Bounced out again, not a great look for the England captain, although he's a man who lives by the sword. Pushed across the batsman by Shami, got too big on him, never in control of the shot and Jadhav did really well running around from fine leg to take the catch diving forwards!
fired in full on off stump, Root blocks steadfastly
over the wicket, good length on off stump, tapped into the covers - wicket maiden for Shami, a brilliant intervention from him here
nearly a mix-up, but Root gets back at the non-striker's end! Tucked into the leg side and Root thought a single was on before being sent back by his partner
comes forward and strokes this through mid-off
floated up from over the wicket, Root punches down the ground with an open face
drifting straighter with his line, worked to the on side
bit of grip now, clips the outside edge but dies in front of slip, runs away for a single
floated up on the stumps and Root goes back to nudge one behind square on the leg side
tight lines from Shami, who's on one at the moment
fullish, not far from sneaking under the bat as Root drops it in defence
short ball, Root takes it on confidently and swings one away through square leg
pitched up around off stump, Stokes pushes it along the carpet to mid-off
slower ball, kicking up as Stokes stays in the crease and steers towards point
short ball, 134kph/83mph and Stokes is happy enough to swat it into the ground
length ball on middle and leg, stabbed towards midwicket from the crease
angled across, 133kph/82mph and tapped to extra cover coming on to the front footq
on the stumps, Stokes chops down on it and Root calls him through as the ball rolls behind square
length ball sliding in and whipped off the legs for one
pitched up a fraction, Stokes guides one more off the pads through backward square
fired in straight, Root tucks to the leg side
over the wicket, tossed up and cramped on leg stump as he tries to sweep
pushed through and tapped to the leg side
flighted, outside off and Stokes reverses the hands, breaks the boundary drought with a slap past short third man! Chahal holds his face, frustrated at seeing that one get away
could be a tight second... but Stokes charges back in time! Came down the pitch menacingly, looking to cosh through mid-on but got a thickish inside edge square for a couple
straightening on the pads and skimmed fine for a couple more
floated up full, defended towards midwicket
pitched up on middle stump, Root flicks but finds midwicket
lovely timing from Root, clips this off his toes in front of the man in the deep on the leg side and they hare back for two
short ball, rolls the wrists on a smooth pull for one to the sweeper
full and straight and glanced through backward square, just the one on offer
goes back and across and dabs this to third man
short of a length, spits up off the deck and Stokes thrusts the hands a\t it, punched through point
dragged down the leg side, Stokes has a hoick on one knee but misses out

tossed up straight, Stokes goes leg side, bullocked up over square and bouncing beyond the man running around! Shami was behind square and couldn't get there, though Chahal looked like he wanted to see more than a forlorn outstretched arm
flighted, Stokes sweeps this hard and flat straight to deep backward square this time
lobbed up and worked off the pads
oh boy, that's OUTRAGEOUS! Reverse slog-sweep over deep point! Stokes turns himself completely around and scoops this high into the crowd with a murderous mow of the hands!
flatter delivery, punched down the ground
Root now gets funky, gets away a cheeky full-face dink over Dhoni, short third man cuts it off though
pitched up, Root squeezes it down into the off side behind square
pushed across the left-hander, Stokes makes a bit of room to slice a couple through backward point
skips down and humped over extra cover! Not right out of the middle but he clears the inner ring and Pandya has to run a long way round in the deep
whirring in on a length, Root opts for defence on off stump
dug in short, good height around off stump but Root controls his pull for one to deep square leg
short ball again, Stokes rocks back and skims one more down to fine leg
no one out there, though! Pongo over the leg side and it goes all the way! Just a skip and a clip off the legs but launched a full 91 metres, well beyond the rope
pushed through as Stokes comes down and whips away to deep midwicket
slapped off the back foot, misfield gives Root four! Pandya was sliding across to cut it off at deep extra cove but somehow ended up missing the ball. Just Root's second boundary
tossed up and poked into the covers
pushed through and tapped down into the infield
full on the stumps, Root swings across the line and sends this uppishly towards deep square leg for one - Chahal completes his most-expensive spell in ODIs
pitched up and clipped into a gap on the leg side
pitched up and poked back into the off side
short ball, 142kph/88mph and Stokes is dancing across to try and ramp the ball, ends up aiming a roundhouse swipe towards fine leg but doesn't connect!
driven to mid-off, Root was looking for one but has to scurry back
dug in short, this time Stokes manages to get it away on the pull
full and wide, Root goes back and angles the bat for a single to third man
low full toss on middle and leg stump, Root hoicks it for one
another full toss, slotted off the pads between two men in the deep! Poor ball and Stokes carts it into the gap for four
swung for one to deep square leg
bit of width, Root goes back and dabs the ball late, terrific diving stop from Rishabh Pant at short third man - that was heading for four, otherwise!
short ball, pulled hard and again Pant throws himself on the edge of the ring to limit the damage!
pitched up outside off, Stokes attempts some funkydory reverse-kerjiggering once more.. and fails to connect

full and scooped leg side... but brilliantly caught by Pandya running around at fine leg! So Root's attempt to up the ante ends his stay, though it's probably acceptable collateral damage for England. Third wicket of a good display from Shami
pitched up and drilled into the covers for one

full on middle and leg, 141kph/88mph and Buttler flicks it straight to midwicket, Stokes was halfway down when the run was refused.... but Bumrah misses with a throw to the non-striker's end!' Would have been long gone
short ball, Buttler sees it early - KABOOM! Six over deep midwicket! He's absolutely smashed that, sends his second ball into the crowd!
slings down a full bunger, Buttler times this off his toes, should get a couple to deep midwicket... but a misfield from Kohil, of all people, means they can come back for three!

shortish, slower ball, I think, Stokes' bottom hand comes off the bat as he carves through extra cover - needs a diving stop out on the rope, prevents a third this time; fifty up for Stokes, third in a row at this World Cup
shortish outside off, coming in from a wide angle, Buttler waits and runs it behind point
bottom-handed whip through the leg side, Stokes connects well and gets it in front of the deep midwicket sweeper
superb ball from Bumrah, dipping slower delivery on off, can't get under it
dug in short as Stokes went across and tried to premeditate, can't connect with a wild swing - and he won't get the wide he wants, either
pitched up and squeezed into the off side
canny stuff once again, full and quick outside off, 143kph/88mph and Buttler is late on a drive, beaten - just four off the over from Bumrah
full toss, Stokes toe-ends a club down the ground, beats the man running across at long-on - that'll be four!
pitched up on middle and off, Stokes helicopters this away through wide long-on for a couple more
full, 141kph/88mph and drilled down the ground, just a single - that's the England 300 on the board
pace off, but he's missed his mark, sliding leg side and Buttler heaves it away behind square on the leg side!
another full bunger, c-r-u-u-u-u-u-u-u-u-u-n-c-h-e-d over long-off! Didn't look like he'd timed it but the ball sails just over the rope!

got him, juggles the caught and bowled! Nervous moment for Shami, as a dolly return catch almost squirted from his grasp - but he's removed the ever-dangerous Buttler! Went to his strength, short and fast and Buttler's pull came off the splice, went straight up
fired in full and straight, clipped off the pads as he overbalances a touch
slower ball, wide of off stump and Stokes hangs back to guide it for a single
dug in short, 143kph/89mph and Woakes flaps at a pull, top-edged down towards fine leg... but it doesn't carry
full on off, Stokes bottom-hands a whip firmly but straight to midwicket
banged in at 90mph, top-edged again but this will fly for four! Got a chunk of bat on it and the ball went between the two men back, only the third boundary Bumrah has conceded today
fired in full, Woakes doesn't know much about it but digs the ball out for one
hammers the short ball, this time the loopy pull will go to hand! Shami gets his five-for, using the bumper well, Woakes just swinging blindly and sends it to deep square leg running in
round the wicket, goes full but this becomes a half-volley that Stokes brutalises through cow for four! Dealt with
six this time, swung over deep backward square leg! poor bowling from Shami, dots it on a length and Stokes just picks it up by the shoulders and dumps it over the rope!
smeared wide of long-off! Leaning back as Shami misses the blockhole again, Kohli is beaten running along the boundary, doesn't even bother to put in the dive
pitched up and slugged without timing to deep extra cover
full length, driven down the ground to long-on and Stokes says 'No, thanks, I'll keep the strike'
pinpoint yorker to start with, excellent bowling and Stokes can only drop his bat on it and shake his head
full and clipped off the pads, out towards deep backward square leg... Stokes slips at the non-striker's end, no chance to push for the second run
full outside off, big ole breezy yahoo from Plunkett, fails to connect but Stokes is sprinting down to run the bye as Dhoni shies and misses

scooped off the stumps - but straight to fine leg! There was a man back and Stokes picked him out, having wracked his brains for any method of getting Bumrah away! The front foot is tight on the line but I think that's just about okay... Yep, Stokes was lingering on the boundary rope but he's told to be on his way
brilliant once again from Bumrah, fired in full and there's another swing and a miss
finishes it off, yorkers to order and Plunkett can only manage to squirt it a few yards into the off side for one - immaculate figures from Bumrah, whose last five overs went for just 26
good carry, on a length and shaping away outside off, lets it go through
back of a length outside off, has a waft at it, under-edges it and drops it down on the pitch
brings it straighter, on the fourth stump line and fuller, Rahul comes on the front foot to drive gently to cover
good length on off, and jagging across a bit, thuds into the bat as Rahul defends getting behind it
another back of length outside off, and he under-edges an attempted square drive
closer to off stump on a length, punched to extra cover. maiden to start
that's just outrageous. Very first ball, it's a half volley outside off alright but he seems to gently push it only. and it races to the long-off boundary
goes back to length now and Rohit defends with a straight bat
back of a length outside off again, punched to cover
dropped by Root at second slip. Easy, easy chance what have you done Root! Shaping away from Rohit, who goes for the big drive, gets a healthy edge - very straight to Root. In and out.
and there's the sprinkling of insult to add to injury. Archer goes too full again and Rohit just opens the face of his bat to stroke this through point
better line, kissing the fourth stump and getting good carry from a length, Rohit lets it go
good length outside off, lets it go
back of a length on off again, punched to cover off the back foot

caught and bowled! Woakes brought the line closer, Rahul was moving inside the line to flick this, too early into it and gets a leading edge. it's dying on Woakes but he gets down low and snaffles it, diving forward and to his right! Rahul's not had a memorable match, wonder if his injury was hampering him when trying to play that shot? Anyway, he's gone.
length ball outside off, he goes forward to meet it with bat and pad close together and punches to point
fuller, clipped to mid-on
full and close to off stump, driven to cover. second maiden for Woakes
short of a length, tapped back to the bowler off the back foot
ah, he's hit that spot outside off on a length from which balls die. Gets it to nip in and Rohit has to get his bat down in a hurry to ensure it doesn't hit pad first
back of a length outside off, punched to point
beauty. But good on Rohit to play inside the line and with bat close to body. Beautiful channel from Archer, angling in one degree and moving away just that much
fuller, punch-driven, but can't beat the off-side ring
dug it in short and Rohit wanted to pull, but that's 146 kph and sometimes those are too quick for even Rohit to pull. Gets a glove down to fine leg
fuller outside off, patted towards cover
straighter, clipped off the pads to midwicket
very full outside off, punched with an angled bat towards point
nipping into him and he was looking to flick it away but it hits him on the pad. Going down comfortably though
seemed to stop on Rohit a bit off a length outside off, and he had to check his drive. Trickles to mid-off

run out chance almost Rohit patted it towards short mid-on and set off, but Woakes swooped on it like an eagle on his follow through and under-armed it back to the stumps. Rohit had to scramble back. Three maidens in a row!
snorter What an absolute ripper. Bouncer that's homing in on the throat and Kohli has to sway his head out of the way at the last moment
edge goes wide of second slip! A tentative jab by Kohli, who was coming on the front foot, but Archer had bowled it on a length and moved it away.
creamed - Kohli's saying he's not going to give this over to Archer entirely. Leans into the cover drive and sends it Rolls Royce like to the cover boundary. Unfazed by the last two balls
length ball, tapped back to the bowler's left
good length, on the fourth stump, punched towards point
good length and on a tight line again, Kohli is happy to defend into the offside
fuller, first runs off Woakes. Thick inside edge off a forward prod that goes to square leg
full outside off, Kohli moves across to clip to mid-on
Full outside off again, Kohli goes across and gets nice timing on his flick, but a wide mid-on slides to his right and fields
length ball outside off, and Woakes almost ran into that deep silly mid-off fielder in picking it up on his follow through. Almost, no damage done.
under-edge! Shorter outside off, Kohli saw the chance to crash this off the back foot but gets an under edge that bounces psat off stump
he gets the placement right that time, walks across to another full delivery to clip to deep midwicket
full, tight on off stump, gets behind it and blocks it back to the bowler
pulls the length a bit back but keeps the line on off, Rohit taps it gently to mid-on
takes the quick single that time. Could do it because he played it with very soft hands, same ball, same line, length on off, but good calling and running
sticks to the tight length outside off to Kohli also, and he taps it back. 150 kph
digs it in short and climbing into the body, Kohli swivels to pull but doesn't get hold of it properly, pulls it down to fine leg
pacy bouncer. Climbing outside off, Rohit throws a full-blooded pull at it but doesn't connect. Goes over his shoulder
imperious. He's treated Woakes like a net bowler there. Walks down the track and drives him over extra cover.
goes fuller that time, but Kohli stays in his crease and clips to mid-on
length outside off, jabs it towards point. looking for a single, rightly sent back
very full outside off, Kohli was in position early having gone across and flicks it off his pads to deep square leg
walks down the track too, but Woakes pulls his length back and Rohit can only nurdle it into the leg-side
fuller on off, steered to point
back of a length outside off has worked for Archer, so he sticks to it, on the fourth stump line. Defended into the offside
back of a length again, gets this to nip back in, Kohli stabs it into the offside from his crease
swing and a miss Moved across and wanted to smash that into oblivious but the pull shot connects only with air. Archer shortened his length there a bit
back to length bowling around off, and back to tapping it back to the bowler
oh this is good bowling. Gets this to rear up from back of a length and Kohli can only awkwardly dab it down to third man, nearly off shoulder height
good length outside off, defended.
back of a length outside off, sits up a bit and he can punch this through extra cover
fuller on the stumps, defended back to the bowler
full outside off, fluently stroked through cover but there is protection in the deep
given room outside off now, still keeping it full, square drives it with feet static
airy waft outside off and he's lucky he doesn't snick it through. Plunkett got this to nibble off the seam a bit
back of a length and well outside off, Rohit is getting impatient. Aims another big drive but can't connect
back of a length, stump to stump to start, worked off his pads to deep midwicket
back of a length, nipping in, 145kph, jabbed back to the bowler
there's the pull shot. Not all that short, but Rohit created the length by going back and heaved it to the wide long-on boundary
goes fuller and in the channel, Rohit steers to backward point with bat close to his pad
ooooh, too close to cut, but he tried it anyway. Doesn't connect and the ball whistles past off stump. in fact he seemed to have got a faint tickle on it but it landed in front of the keeper.
and he nails another pull. Short ball climbing onto him, swivels and pulls it from leg-stump to fine leg. The fielder is very fine and the ball will beat him
has him feeling outside off for that! You dont normally see Kohli follow the ball with his hands only but that's what he did here, to a length ball outside off
and beaten again! cross-seamer that bounces higher than expected and Kohli is trying to nurdle it to third man but it goes over his bat
this time Kohli decides to take his typical big stride out to meet the ball and runs it to third man off a thick outside edge
fuller on off, stops a bit but Rohit waits on it and strokes it gently through cover
yorker on the fourth stump, dug back out to the bowler
very full on off, gets the front foot moving to drive through cover
moves across again to flick this from outside off to fine leg
digs it in short and quick, but Kohli is onto it, pulls it to deep midwicket from in front of his face, almost standing face to face with the bowler. Bairstow keeps them to two, sprinting around
back of a length and nipping in, Kohli wanted to flick off his pads but doesn't connect. Isn't too happy about missing out
back o fa length but hits the spot at which the ball isn't bouncing much - even though this was 146 kph - and Kohli jabs it from the crease towards point
regal Cracking sound off the bat, driven on the up, giving himself some room and it screams through extra cover and to the boundary
length ball on the stumps, jabs it back past the bowler
outside edge goes to third man. Flayed at it with feet static, takes the outside edge
punches this back of a length ball to extra cover
fuller, pushed to mid-off and takes off for a quick single
back of a length, scrambled seam that holds on the pitch, Rohit wants to pull but has completed the shot before the ball goes past
this one goes through at quicker pace and Rohit misses with the cut.
takes a step down the track but the bowler bangs it in and Rohit is late on the pull, gets pinged on the back of the helmet
length ball outside off, Kohli walks across and slaps it to deep square. Bairstow runs to his right to save this one
fuller length outside off, Kohli meets it with the full face of the bat, to push to cover
length ball, tucked from off stump towards midwicket
back of a length on the fourth stump, stays in his crease and glides it off an open bat face to third man
clipped off his pads, but nice work by Root at midwicket to dive to his right and stop the ball, cutting down any thoughts of a single
another length ball dying on Kohli he ends up defending it. Swishes angrily at the air after that
nicely stroked past a diving backward point, to his right. Raises the fifty-run stand, but it's come at a fairly plodding rate

sumptuous once again by Kohli. Didn't have to move his feet, but his balance was perfect, and he unleashes another drive through cover, bisecting the in-field and placing it well enough so that the man at sweeper cover can't get to it
short ball, climbing on him, defended back
fuller outside off, driven again but not off the middle. Archer at mid-off tumbles to his right to save
there's the Rohit we know!. Short ball, pulled off his hips in front of square, two bounces into the midwicket boundary
guided to point
dug this in short but it's pacy. Kohli wants to pull it, but gets it off the bottom half of the bat to midwicket
cracked off the backfoot, but a diving stop by backward point keeps them to one
too close to cut and too quick too perhaps at 147 kph. Rohit doesn't connect
back of a length outside off, dabbed to third man
back of a length on leg stump, 147 kph again. Kohli can't connect with the pull
another back of length ball but this time outside off, well placed by Kohli just past the backward point fielder. Third man has to run to his right to collect
tosses up a loopy, lazy legbreak outside off, patted towards point
gives this some air, turning a touch as Rohit clouts one through the covers
flighted, a touch wide and Kohli throws the hands, mistimes a mow into the off side
tighter to off stump, presses forward to defend
pushed through out the front of the hand, Kohli drops back and whips into the leg side
legbreak on middle and leg stump, tickeld down the ground
shortish and tucked down behind square on the off side
angling in with the arm, Kohli punches breezily down the ground
length ball on the stumps, defended
138kph/86mph on off stump, sliced, one hand off the bat - but just manages to clear the infield! Stokes is frustrated, but signs that Rohit is unhappy with the way England have tied him down
lovely timing from his partner by contrast, whistled away into a gap in front of deep midwicket! Hands, eyes and bat all synching up to perfection for Kohli
beautiful shot once again, timed on the up through the covers, well stopped out on the boundary - half-century up for Kohli, who's got that look in his eye
now Rohit finds the middle of the bat, lofted over cover and away! Too full outside off from Rashid and he's pinged for the rope
floated up and defended
spinning on leg stump, hits the pad and rolls back past the stumps
gives this some air, Rohit comes down and drives one in to out
flighted, steps on to the front foot and strokes down the ground to long-off
pushed through, slightly wide and Rohit clatters a cut past the dive of point, Vince left in the dirt and that'll scoot to the fence, too
dropped into the covers for a quick single
short of a length, coming back in and Rohit thick-edges down into his front pad
fuller, 142kph/88mph on middle and off, flicked to midwicket
belted through cover! Full and wide, invitingly slottable and that's what Rohit does, latching on to skelp four
on the stumps, tucked away for one
length ball, going on with the arm, Kohli dabs into a gap at midwicket, thinks about two... India bring up their 100, skipping along nicely now
punched down the ground with a bottom-handed flick
flights the legbreak, Rohit attempts to paddle... Ooh, where's that gone?? The ball lobs up behind the batsman, not far from the stumps in the end
tucked into the leg side
Kohli uses the feet and taps for one
floated full on off, defended softly
full and flighted on off stump, another creamy lofted cover drive from Rohit! That's a princely hit and quite a way to bring up fifty, too
full on the stumps and clipped for a single to deep square leg - that's the 100-run stand, too
shortish, Rohit is back in the crease and glides it fine for a couple
pitched up, worked off the pads again
nippy bouncer from Stokes, over the shoulder as Kohli swivels and thinks better of pulling
banged in at 142kph/88mph and worked off the body to leg
good length around the line of off, Rohit bows his head over a forward block
brutal striking... Full and wide and laced disdainfully in front of the cover sweeper, who had barely moved before he had to give up the chase
floated up and worked off the pads behind square
tossed up on the stumps, driven down the ground
slows up his pace, letting the legbreak turn as Kohli goes back and punches square off the back foot
bowling Rashy! Beautiful drift and dip before the ball spins sharply past the outside edge... Only takes one good ball
floated up on off, cut firmly through point for one into the deep
short ball, heading leg side and Rohit gingers up the front knee as he whips a pull away through backward square
width now, 139kph/86mph and flayed through point! There was a man out there but he barely moved
fuller and guided to the deep backward point boundary! Three in a Ro... Sitting back and just steering it behind the sweeper, superb timing again
cross-seam, pitched up and mistimed on the up, bounces short of mid-off
tighter from Stokes, played back down the track
back of a length, wide of the stumps and angled down to third man - now that's an over to make England fans shift uneasily in their seats
lobbed up on the stumps, swept and swept hard! Four more through square leg, taken on the full and rammed home
pushed through, shorter length and tucked to long-on
flat legbreak outside off, Kohli drops back to cut
tossed up and spinning away, too far for the umpire's liking
straighter line and tapped towards extra cover
better length from Rashid, straightening on middle and leg, Rohit blocks
tossed up full outside off, throws the hands but slaps straight to backward point
starts with a legcutter, gripping a touch outside off as Kohli dabs at it and misses
good length and poked towards backward point
slower ball, leg side and flicked to fine leg for one
in the channel, Rohit drops back and angles one more behind point
short ball, 148kph/92mph and Kohli rides it well, cross-batted dab to third man
pitched up and driven, the crowd erupts in expectation... but that's just one to the cover sweeper
oh, that's gone wrong... flung down very wide, another for the underused extras column
back of a length, 132kph/82mph and lofted up over cover, bounces out to the sweeper

[rubs eyes] oh Virat... Steers a length ball to backward point! YES, YOU READ THAT RIGHT! Another fifty but no cigar for Kohli, who has given England an opening just when things were beginning to get itchy! Eager to get bat on ball, maybe skidded through a touch, and Vince swallowed a fat outside edge
tapped into the covers, and what are you thinking Rishabh...? Has to turn and fling himself for his ground after setting off instinctively!
strangled lbw appeal, maybe too high - they scamper through this time, as the ball loops towards backward point
defended on the stumps, AND PANT HAS GONE WALKABOUT AGAIN! Backing up a long way and then realising there was absolutely no run on, but the throw was off target
shortish and glided for a calm single this time
good length around off stump, defended
comes across and shows this a straight bat
touch short, tries to whip this to leg and gets an inside edge on to his pads
good length, around off stump and Rohit again plays watchfully into the covers
slower ball, worked into a gap for one
good length on off stump, 142kph/88mph and met coming forwards by Pant, who closes the face and whips past the dive of midwicket for his first runs
back of a length and turned off the hip
tight lines from Plunkett, met coming across and steered to backward point
shortish, 131kph/81mph and Rohit drops back to angle this down to third man
possibly a cutter, Pant leans out and defends into the covers
short of a length, jagging off the surface as Pant heaves at it and fails to connect
another cutter into the surface, down the leg side, though
nagging away, 128kph/79mp[h on middle and off, Pant works it to midwicket
short and wide, neatly swiped off the back foot by Rohit, runs away to deep backward point
on the attack again, launches a cutter over mid-on! Half a step and then hits through the line, up and over the infield for back-to-back boundaries
fullish on the stumps, straight-driven for one as mid-on comes across
hurled down at 143kph/89mph, Wood on his knees in his follow-through as Pant crabs forward to defend
full and fast and clipped off the pads through square leg for one
dug in short at 88mph, Rohit calmly swivels on a pull to deep backward square
short ball, Rohit miscues into the leg side... but it lands safely! Pitch wedge rather than the driver there, but he got away with it
on the body and turned to midwicket
short ball, rising up around the armpit, Pant swats a pull for a couple
drilled in front of the cover sweeper! Lovely timing coming forwards and Woakes fails to cut it off despite a full-length dive
short of a length, rocks back and dabs this behind point
length on the stumps, Rohit loses his shape but gets a thickish inside edge
dug in, sure enough, mistimed on the pull for one dribbling towards midwicket
good line, just outside off and played late with an open face for a single to third man
short of a length, pulled away through square
banged in at 141kph/88mph and Pant hops on one leg to pull at the last minute, a blur of limbs for one to fine leg
short again, over the stumps and paddled down into the midwicket area, no chance of a second
fired across the bows, Pant plays it late again, slightly outside-edgey but the ball runs wide of Buttler... just one as third man comes across, to end an over of singles
good length, but slightly off pace around the off stump. Pant defends
practically sweeps the good length ball outside off to deep square leg. Originally thinking about a pull, maybe, but then with the pace taken off again, he decides to get even lower and sweep
works the full ball on the pads to midwicket

another century! And it comes off a neat little chop behind point. There's really not enough room for the full blooded shot. So he checks himself. Which he's done all innings considering this is a two-paced pitch. Good gritty innings from India's outstanding opener.
short and outside off, slashes it over to deep third man
pulls the bouncer on middle away to deep square leg
the bat's gone flying to the keeper! He was looking to swat this over deep square, but doesn't connect, because the bat's flown out of his hand and over his head. Landed in front of Buttler
another big swing outside off, no connection. Bat stays in hand though
nails it this time! Short ball and he picks out the short boundary at square leg, pulls with power and precision
rinse, repeat - but there is a fielder square now, so he gets only a single
swipes a full toss down to square leg, tried to hit it too hard and ended up not timing it. Once bounce to the fielder

clears mid-off. He wasn't intending to go there, this is a pull shot over extra cover that goes for four. Was late on it, bounces up till his shoulder but he swipes it so hard that even with that kind of contact, he's standing almost parallel to the batsman - it carries over the in-field
he's taken the big one first ball back What a return! Slower ball, off-cutter that he rolled fingers over. Rohit wanted to send it over cow corner, ends up edging behind.

cracked through the offside first ball. Short and outside off, he plays a horizontal bat slap through cover. Bairstow does excellently to tumble, slide and save the boundary, thrown in with some fancy footwork too

reverse sweep, top edge, and safe! everything happened in that ball. Chuck those self-help books and watch Pant for insouciant confidence. Tries a reverse sweep off a length ball, it takes the top edge, bashes into his body and lobs up near point. Three fielders, including keeper and bowler, converging. But safe
punched back to the bowler off the back foot
Pandya stays deep in his crease as is his wont, and horizontal-bat-slaps this to mid-off
fuller outside off, and superb timing on that, just stroked through extra cover. Some running for the man in the deep to do
swing and a miss - there's going to be one an over with Pant. Length ball angling across, targetting cow corner, connects with air
nibbling around the offstump line and guided to third man, who's standing very fine

big shout for lbw but they won't review. Wood was interested, but I think too high. Comes in with the angle and catches Pandya on the crease, hits his pad flap. Morgan consults Buttler who advises against the review
goes well back and swats this to mid-on
length all on leg stump, and Pant was walking across to cart this over square leg. Doesn't connect, and wears it on the thigh pad
smack that goes... over wide mid-on. Too full and a full extension of the arms to send this to the wide long-on boundary
length ball wide of off, but Pandya has moved across and smeared this with power - straight to extra cover though

stunning. He was moving across, Woakes tried for the leg-stump yorker, doesn't quite pull it off, Pandya goes very deep and unleashes a full-blooded on-drive, holds his shape beautifully and it goes over mid-on
and that's the bottom hand power of Pandya on show. Not that short but he goes deeper and slaps this through extra cover. No chance for the fielder who is very square

outrageous! There are two fielders on the legside in the V - long-on and deep midwicket. And he's bisected them. Too full from Woakes and with Hardik going so deep in his crease he can lift this off a half-volley and into the gap
walks further across and twirls this to deep square, but splendid work by the man who's quite wide and dives to save the boundary
bullet straight drive but Root sprints very fast from long-on to slide and save

stunning take by Woakes! He's been carted for runs in the past over, but he pulls off a ripper on the square leg boundary, running and diving to his left, perfectly timed to snatch the ball inches from the turf. Pant was looking for his favourite walk-across-hoick to square leg and seemed to have nailed it. Until Woakes flew past.
slower ball on a length, walks across and swipes it down past the keeper very fine, but fine leg is also fine so can get around in time
goes for the wide one outside off and it's ruled just too wide. So he'll have to rebowl that

poor bowling and he's punished, but Bairstow hares from deep square leg to his left and dives to save the boundary. Too short, sat up and Hardik swatted it into the legside. Outstanding work by Bairstow.
another short ball, this time up to the chest and Hardik places his pull shot well to get another two, between square leg and fine leg
fuller outside off, pushed to mid-off from deep in his crease but he's quick to take off and get the single
length ball outside off, he's just let this go. Wise perhaps, keeps Pandya on strike for the next over
cleverly bowled, slower ball and fuller, wide of off, Pandya is already standing well across so it cramps him for room and he ends up pushing it back to the bowler
another slower one and fuller outside off, smeared through extra cover
full on the fifth stump, Dhoni lashes it through cover
length ball outside off, he's bowling it slower - that's the pace to go, ask Pandya to generate all the power. He flat bats it through extra cover again
just past Rashid at backward point. This would have been another Superman catch, he was flying to his left. Full toss outside off, and Pandya lashed this hard, gets a boundary
well wide of off again, but Pandya is standing across, so it's like a length ball on the fifth stump, chops it past cover
flat and on the stumps, punched to long-on. Stokes is there so they wisely decide against the second
too short and Dhoni rocks back to pull this, but cannot go past short fine leg
bowling a good restrictive line is Rashid, pitches on leg and spins across, Dhoni can only tuck it to short fine
flat and on leg stump again - this is good bowling at this stage - and Hardik can only push at it to long-on
sharply spinning from leg across Dhoni, who goes right back and whips this to long-on
fuller on the pads, and driven to long-on again. Successful over from Rashid, kept the runs to singles only
has an almighty thwack at it, but without timing. Only 120 kph, Pandya can only hit it to long-off
high, very high and lands just inside the boundary. Got waaay more height than distance but it lands a foot inside long-off boundary and rolls over. Full swing of the bat, got the toe end
surprises him with a short one outside off at normal pace and Dhoni is late on it, the ball thuds into the end of his bat and rolls back towards the bowler
keeps it full and tight, no room for Dhoni to free his arms and he clips it to long-on
excellent by Woakes, another one with the pace taken completely off, length outside off, and Pandya thrashes it again with a horizontal bat but only trickles to long-off
back of a length outside off, another slower one. Dhoni can't read the change in pace, slashes at it, connects with air
slower ball on the fourth stump, Pandya was backing away and ends up throwing his bat at it, the ball rolls back to Archer
length ball outside off, pace taken off again, and he can only steer to short third man
goes for the quicker yorker, but misses so Dhoni is able to push-drive the ball through cover
back to length ball with the pace taken off, and Dhoni slashes it to short third man. They take the single - England let them, they won't risk overthrows
and that is another good surprise ball, bouncer into the body tucks him up, he moves across and paddles it but short fine is in place. This was also slow, 118 kph
and Archer, the man who can deliver 150kph off an ambling run-up, finishes the over with another 120 kph trundler that Pandya can only jab towards long-off
yorker on the seventh stump, wants to thwack it with a huge bat swing. But it's too far from him and he can't connect cleanly. Trickles back to the bowler
length ball on off, goes aerial now, lifts this over mid-off with a straight drive. But no power on it. England have been BRILLIANT at denying Pandya pace on the ball. Brilliant
bang! This was at normal pace, banged in too short, Dhoni rocks back and slams it into the midwicket boundary. India will need many more of those though
and loses his line to go very far down leg. He'll have to rebowl that
pace off again, length outside off, and Dhoni waits for it and batters it towards cover

caught by Vince at long-on and that should be the game? Pandya was frustrated into mis-timing that due to England's plans against him. This was on a length and around the fifth stump, he was moving across and didn't have the room to free his arms but aimed a big swipe anyway. Takes the top edge and swirls to long-on. That popping noise you hear is the sound of several countries' hopes being burst
slower ball, length outside off, beaten by the lack of pace as he tries to heave across the line
short of a length and into his body, swivels and keeps his pull along the ground to deep square leg
back of a length, normal pace nipping into Jadhav, who tickles it down to fine leg
too short and sat up asking to be hit, Dhoni pulls this to the fine leg boundary
again back of a length angling into him, goes to pull but gets a glove down to fine leg
another ball climbing into his chest and swivelled down to fine leg
another one climbing into his chest and swivelled down to fine leg
length ball outside off and nipping away, squirted into the offside
length ball on the stumps again, and it's just a single, turned to square leg.
and there's another one, turned off his pads into the leg side
slower ball, strays on the pads, he tries to sweep it hard but doesn't connect and it only goes to short fine leg
moving across but Archers sees that and bowls a short one well outside off that ends up cramping him, so he can only dab it to third man
full on off, driven to the man at sweeper cover
climbs on him and takes the glove while he's trying to hook it, goes to fine leg. Painful blow, hit on the right thumb.
short ball into his body again but Jadhav swivels to pull - doesn't get timing on it and can only send it to deep square leg
too short and pulled away, but once again it is to a fielder in the deep
backing away, but he follows him with the short ball, slashed down to third man
short down legside and he'll have to rebowl that
down the track, big swing but the ball sneaks through under his bat, past leg stump
digs this in short again, pulled to deep square leg
banged in on a hard length and Dhoni misses the pull again, the ball goes past off stump
misfield by Stokes at deep midwicket - and he can't believe it. Fuller and quicker, Dhoni clears his leg and smears it into the legside. Stokes has it covered but it suddenly slips through
slashed to deep point
yorker on the fifth stump, twirled to deep midwicket
waits for  it, slower ball, length on off, pushed to point
finishes with a quick bouncer, too quick for Jadhav who is late into the pull. Ball sails over his shoulder
smashed and India's first six of the innings comes in the last over. Normal pace, banged in short and Dhoni corks it out over deep square leg
fuller on off, smeared to deep midwicket. He refuses the single!
another one right out of the screws, nails the pull but this time the placement is not as good, Stokes collects on the bounce at the midwicket boundary. This time Dhoni takes the single.
backs away and slashes this over point. Another one banged in short and a well-executed shot. Maybe Dhoni shouldn't have refused that single eh?
he responds with a quick bouncer on the stumps and Jadhav has not backed away enough to cart that into the offside. Takes the end of his bat and bounces back to the bowler
backing away again, Woakes follows him with a yorker that is flicked to deep midwicket and India's unbeaten run in the 2019 World Cup is over. England are back on track, back in the top four.
